CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bessie King, 1914 Laurel Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 3 with question: �Do you think adults in the community are doing enough to foster constructive recreational activities, like playgrounds, centers, places to dance, Little Leagues, etc., for youth?� answer reads: �No, I don�t think so. However, I�ve just lived a short time in the neighborhood where I�m at present.  It seems to me that the kids do not have too many places to play.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bessie King, wearing plaid belted dress, and coat, holding light colored handbag on left arm, standing in front of block wall and store window on right with "Whitehall..." smoking pipe display and paint cans
